data.title: Respect the expand margin for StyleBoxTextures again.
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/8366 and a lot of confusion.

- Commit a4a12a2 sadly forgot to respect the expand margin after retrieving the texture area. I added it back.
- This fixes all the thinned out looks on the Godot UI.
- Also fixed `WindowDialog` drawing code since it was programmed while the expand margins were bugged.

data.title: Use .godot as file extension for project files.
data.body:
Now project files don't have to be named "godot.cfg" anymore, they can have any name so as long as it ends with *.godot.
Also godot will automatically start the editor now if launched with a project file as an argument.
This allows for double-clicking of projects to open them :)

Code-wise this should be complete, but there's still work to do:

- Make a nice icon for godot projects. (ping @djrm)
- Work on installers/packaging -> register the extension and icon with godot. (ping @Calinou)
- Update the 2.1 to 3.0 exporter.

Tested on linux and windows so far.
Closes #6915

data.title: Removed the deprecated Import menu from the main editor.
data.body: Removed the deprecated Import menu from the main editor.

data.title: [3.0] Performance monitors dont report any values
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Linux, 3.0master

**Issue description:**
Performance monitors show all 0 all the time, except for FPS which seems to be working.
Both in profiler and via code.

data.title: color picker doesn't display colors properly
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Linux, 3.0master


**Issue description:**
The color picker used in the inspector (and probably other places) is not showing the color selection rectangle.

Besides that, the hue selection (vertical bar) seems to have a different offset than the real color being selected. One of them appears to be the inverted value of the other.

data.title: [3.0] viewport screen capture doesn't work
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Linux, Godot 3.0 (master)


**Issue description:**
Getting a screen capture from any viewport results in empty data.

**Steps to reproduce:**
```
get_viewport().queue_screen_capture()
yield(get_tree(),"idle_frame")
yield(get_tree(),"idle_frame")
var i = get_viewport().get_screen_capture()
i.save_png("user://cap.png")
```

data.title: Fix editor style box for ToolButton
data.body: same as #8369

data.title: Fix editor style box for ToolButton (2.1)
Update gamepad remapping system to reflect changes in SDL code.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
All

**Issue description:**
It seems like SDL2 has been updated and now has the ability to map only half of a gamepad axis.
https://hg.libsdl.org/SDL/rev/5ea5f198879f

While I haven't found any mappings in the wild using this feature yet, we should implement it in order to keep compatibility. Also it's a very useful feature imho :)

data.title: Make editor splash screen dark like the editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
3.0 master

**Issue description:**
Nice idea making the splashscreen super bright-white and then the editor theme dark, keeps people awake at night ðŸ‘… 

Can we somehow make it as dark as the default editor theme, at least for the editor itself? It's really eye-straining (I hate sunlight so I always program in the dark... alone... that's another story).

**Steps to reproduce:**
Use a nice dark IDE. Turn off lights. Cancel all your friendships. Eat the kitten which always shits on your doormat. Compile Godot and let it run. Congratulations, you just made an appointment with your favorite oculist.

data.title: StyleBoxTexture expand margins not working and bleeding out to bottom
Stylebox "bleeding" outside to the bottom
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10, AMD R9 390, 3.0 master

**Issue description:**
Unifying the drawing logic of Tabs and TabContainer, I'm experiencing weird `draw` results from the tab styleboxes.

The styleboxes aren't defined in any special way. The drawing padding / 9-patch thickness is 4-4-4-0, the content padded a bit further horizontally, and the shadows 2-2-2-0:
```cpp
t->set_stylebox("tab_fg", "Tabs", sb_expand(make_stylebox(tab_current_png, 4, 4, 4, 0, 8, 4, 8, 0), 2, 2, 2, 0));
```
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9631152/24925278/054167c0-1ef8-11e7-85e7-95e295a568f7.png)

Yet the inner part of the image somehow "bleeds" to the bottom - except for the margin parts at the side, resulting in very ugly errors:
- I marked the "bleeding" part red on the "Apple" tab.
- The `Rect2` passed to `draw` is the green rectangle on the "Banana" tab.
- On the `TabContainer` with the close buttons the effect is also noticeable, the shadowy part of the tabs does not extend under the content panel, but the inner part does (which it should'nt as I draw the content panel below the end of the tab rects).

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9631152/24925140/9959ff7c-1ef7-11e7-96f9-47feb7acf5b0.png)

data.title: Icon buttons are "jumpy" on hover in the editor (stylebox mismatch)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux - Godot master/HEAD (faee2fb), 2.1/HEAD (8df5b71, fixed in subsequent revert d8ae244)

**Issue description:**
When you hover buttons with icons in the editor, such as the play/stop scene buttons at the top, or the buttons at the top of each docks, they seem like "jumping", i.e. they are drawn at an offset to their normal stylebox margins.

It's a regression from 98f01f914333eb5e70174c4adf4a5f910a38d645 by @RayKoopa. I've reverted it in 2.1 as I'm releasing 2.1.3-stable - for master maybe it can be fixed differently if we want to keep the patch.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Move your mouse over one of the mentioned icon buttons

data.title: 3.0 Profiler is broken
data.body:
3.0 alpha (April 3rd build) x64 linux kubuntu 16.10

When running PBR demo with profiler you can see values for time taken on processes go all over the place (negatives too). 
![sc-20_28_23-1104](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10696955/24922329/9d2f3316-1ef6-11e7-9c6a-d3ee4329207f.png)
Steps to reproduce: 
1. Launch g3 pbr test 2
2. Launch project
3. Go to Monitors tab
 


VideoMem tab doesn't show path to resource. 
![sc-20_45_00-1104](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10696955/24922650/c17f61e0-1ef7-11e7-882c-45e674c36b03.png)

Steps to reproduce: 
1. Launch pbr test 2 project
2. Go to VideoMem tab of profiler
3. Click "Refresh"

Output is broken on overflow (?) 

![sc-20_42_07-1104](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10696955/24922550/6df35aea-1ef7-11e7-9292-bc18aa5c5277.png)

Steps to reproduce: 
1. Go to WorldEnvironment node.
2. Edit Environment resource
3. Edit values by dragging slider

data.title: Fix a pesky bug in marshalls.cpp/encode_variant
data.body:
Fixes #7556 - running game from editor on LLVM builds.

Yay :star:! Achievement got: Fix a paranormal bug.

(Note: this doesn't need cherrypicking, as the commit that initially got the code there is 13cdccf23b)

data.title: Server platform doesn't build
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux, Godot master/HEAD (faee2fb )

**Issue description:**
The server platform needs fixed. It's true. It's gonna be great.

Two things need to be fixed:
- The AudioServer setup hasn't been fully adapted to the new API. It's easy to fix, just remove that obsolete stuff, and related lines affecting/declaring those members: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/platform/server/os_server.cpp#L72-L78
- Then it needs to be adapted for the GLES3 renderer, and here I have less experience to tell what needs to be done :) It should likely be compared with the implementation in 2.1 to see how it worked.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- `scons p=server`

Also I added a filed to the API that determines if an argument has a default value.

Also re-enabled more init options. I disabled them for debugging purpose.

data.title: [GDNative] function to get class constructor
fix for joystick crash
data.body:
If the mapping is -1, as it will be in the fallback case, it still continues and checks map_db[joy.mapping]
which is quite invalid, and then it goes on to get a property of that, which means if map_db[-1] doesn't cause issues and instead gives, say, NULL, it will still fail.
There's a similar "== -1" check in joy_button, but that code has a return; after it.
So the return; was omitted.

added the missing return in line 915

data.title: "enable_object_picking" disables editor tooltips
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Tested on OSX 10.10 latest and 10.11 latest; Godot **v2.1.2**. Tested with stable and custom builds. Also affects the latest 2.1.3 RC.

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
When a project that has `physics/enable_object_picking` set to false is opened in the editor, tooltips are disabled or no longer working **in the editor** 

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Set `physics/enable_object_picking` to `false` in the Project Settings.
2. Close editor and reopen the project
3. As long as the setting continues to be off (false), when opening that project in the editor, tooltips do not work
4. Set `physics/enabled_object_picking` back to `true`
5. Close and reopen the project and tooltips will be working again
